meanings.definition: Acknowledgment of a source of information or assistance.
meanings.sent1: She always gives proper credits to the authors of the books she references.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to include the necessary credits when using someone else's work.
meanings.sent3: The detective followed the credits to solve the mystery of the missing document.
meanings.sent4: Her credits to the team effort were like a spotlight on their hard work.
meanings.sent5: The credits on the website highlighted the contributors' valuable input.

meanings.definition: A unit of value in education or training.
meanings.sent1: He earned enough credits to graduate from the course.
meanings.sent2: Students need to complete a certain number of credits to pass the class.
meanings.sent3: The credits he gained in the workshop were like stepping stones to success.
meanings.sent4: Her credits in the program were the building blocks of her future career.
meanings.sent5: The credits he received were like gold stars for his hard work.

meanings.definition: A list of the cast and crew involved in a film or television show.
meanings.sent1: The credits at the end of the movie showed the names of all the actors.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to stay for the credits after the film.
meanings.sent3: The credits rolled, and she saw her name among the crew members.
meanings.sent4: In the credits, the names of the talented cast shone brightly.
meanings.sent5: The credits revealed the hard work put in by the entire team.
